data.name: Sample - AWS Network Firewall - 1.0.0
data.description: AWS Network Firewall is a managed service that makes it easy to deploy essential network protections for all of your Amazon Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs). You can filter network traffic at the perimeter of your VPC using AWS Network Firewall. Network Firewall is a stateful, managed, network firewall and intrusion detection and prevention service.

workflows.name: Get List Firewall Policies
workflows.description: Retrieves the metadata for the firewall policies that you have defined.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Get List Firewall Policies

workflows.name: Get List Firewalls
workflows.description: Retrieves the metadata for the firewalls that you have defined.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Get List Firewalls

workflows.name: Get Associate Subnets
workflows.description: Associates the specified subnets in the Amazon VPC to the firewall.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Get Associate Subnets

workflows.name: Delete Firewall Policy
workflows.description: Deletes the specified firewall policy.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Delete Firewall Policy

workflows.name: Describe Firewall Policy
workflows.description: Returns the data objects for the specified firewall policy.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Describe Firewall Policy

workflows.name: Create Firewall Policy
workflows.description: Creates the firewall policy for the firewall according to the specifications.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Create Firewall Policy

workflows.name: Describe Resource Policy
workflows.description: Retrieves a resource policy that you created.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Describe Resource Policy

workflows.name: Create Rule Group
workflows.description: Creates the specified stateless or stateful rule group, which includes the rules for network traffic inspection, a capacity setting, and tags.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Create Rule Group

workflows.name: Describe Firewall
workflows.description: Returns the data objects for the specified firewall.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Describe Firewall

workflows.name: Disassociate Subnets
workflows.description: Removes the specified subnet associations from the firewall.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Disassociate Subnets

workflows.name: Delete Firewall
workflows.description: Deletes the specified Firewall and its FirewallStatus . This operation requires the firewall's DeleteProtection flag to be FALSE. You can't revert this operation.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Delete Firewall

workflows.name: Get List Tag For Resource
workflows.description: Retrieves the tags associated with the specified resource.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Get List Tag For Resource

routes.name: Start -> Get List Tag For Resource

workflows.name: Describe Rule Group
workflows.description: Returns the data objects for the specified rule group.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Describe Rule Group

workflows.name: Describe Logging Configuration
workflows.description: Returns the logging configuration for the specified firewall.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Describe Logging Configuration

workflows.name: Get List Rule Groups
workflows.description: Retrieves the metadata for the rule groups that you have defined.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Get List Rule Groups

workflows.name: Create Firewall
workflows.description: Creates an AWS Network Firewall Firewall and accompanying FirewallStatus for a VPC.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Create Firewall

workflows.name: Delete Resource Policy
workflows.description: Deletes a resource policy that you created.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Delete Resource Policy

workflows.name: Delete Rule Group
workflows.description: Deletes the specified Rule Group.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Delete Rule Group

workflows.name: Get Associate Firewall Policy
workflows.description: Get associates a FirewallPolicy to a Firewall. A firewall policy defines how to monitor and manage your VPC network traffic, using a collection of inspection rule groups and other settings.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Get Associate Firewall Policy

workflows.name: Tag Resource
workflows.description: Adds the specified tags to the specified resource.

arguments.title: AWS Network Firewall: Tag Resource
